flow.descriptionCdata:
ff0af67a-7099-477d-aa54-481ebeef9164.036f64b1-86b9-4a92-880e-1098c38bd08d.transition.description=One or more services are invalid ff0af67a-7099-477d-aa54-481ebeef9164.0417eb50-7291-453f-9e84-9879f3fa45f4.description=
Useful Op to keep a running results.
Takes a string input (resultText) and appends this to a global context key of "runningResults". As a result, the context key whose name is in the keyName input will be appended with the string from the input resultText.

Input Parameters\:
keyName - name of context key to append to
resultText - string input to append
delimiter - (leave blank for none) the delimiter to put between what is already in keyName before appending resultText

Responses\:
success - assigned the context variable

Returns\:
The the value of the context variable it appended to.

Context\:
runningResults

Scriptlet Example\:
currentResults \= scriptletContext.get("runningResults");

if (currentResults \=\= null) {
   currentResults \= resultText;
} else {
   currentResults +\= resultText;
}


scriptletContext.putGlobal("runningResults", currentResults);
ff0af67a-7099-477d-aa54-481ebeef9164.07c0ef1d-ec9e-473a-8a7c-5698f4225ec4.transition.description=One or more services did not start ff0af67a-7099-477d-aa54-481ebeef9164.18226518-fd17-467a-9472-f14fbf109953.description=
Checks to see if a list contains every element in another list.

Inputs\:
sublist -The contained list.
container - The containing list.
delimiter - A delimiter separating elements in the two lists.
ignoreCase - If set to 'True' then the compare is not case sensitive. Default is True

Responses\:
true - sublist is contained in container.
false - sublist is not contained in container.

Results\:
Result - All items contained in the sublist that are not in the container.
ff0af67a-7099-477d-aa54-481ebeef9164.1c1a66df-6e91-4f55-8d9b-778467d8f874.description=
Check to see if the value stored in a specified flow variable, denoted by key, is null.

Inputs\:
keyName - The key to check, i.e. the name of the flow variable.

Returns\: 
The value in the specified key, i.e. flow variable.

Responses\:
isNull - If the key is a null pointer, i.e. the flow variable doesn't have an assigned value.
notNull - If some value is stored in the key, i.e the flow variable has a value assigned.
ff0af67a-7099-477d-aa54-481ebeef9164.1d0413e2-c74c-4b3c-a6b1-b1ebc664d6de.prompt=Target Windows host\: ff0af67a-7099-477d-aa54-481ebeef9164.2cac4101-191b-4991-b9ec-f94c833bb028.description=Iterates through a list of values. Inputs\: list - The list to iterate through. separator - A delimiter that separates elements in the list. Returns\: The current element of the list, if the response is has more Responses\: has more - Another value was in the list, and has been returned. has no more - The iterator has gone fully through the list. This response will only be returned once per iteration through the list, a subsequent call to the Iterator will restart the Iteration through the list. failure - failed to process the list. Note\: Where the iterator is in the list is tracked by each step's unique id. Therefore you can iterate on the same list from multiple steps simultaneously. WARNING\: Any step that will use the results of this Iterator operation will, by default, attempt to assign that step's inputs from a flow variable. If this is left checked, then the first element of the iterator will be used for every cycle of iteration. ff0af67a-7099-477d-aa54-481ebeef9164.3d9917fc-4ea3-43e7-8412-f8c9025b8482.prompt=Character encoding used by target Windows host\: ff0af67a-7099-477d-aa54-481ebeef9164.3e276eba-db33-4be4-a086-60d33c4ef2a7.description=
Check to see if the value stored in a specified flow variable, denoted by key, is null.

Inputs\:
keyName - The key to check, i.e. the name of the flow variable.

Returns\: 
The value in the specified key, i.e. flow variable.

Responses\:
isNull - If the key is a null pointer, i.e. the flow variable doesn't have an assigned value.
notNull - If some value is stored in the key, i.e the flow variable has a value assigned.
ff0af67a-7099-477d-aa54-481ebeef9164.414e5089-c31c-40a3-8309-754d47cbde7d.transition.description=Started ${service} successfully ff0af67a-7099-477d-aa54-481ebeef9164.440813bb-0338-4f3f-99ae-208557a5445a.prompt=HostName\: ff0af67a-7099-477d-aa54-481ebeef9164.4ce4ec87-c0c1-4727-9248-4da95a6409f1.prompt=Password\: ff0af67a-7099-477d-aa54-481ebeef9164.6035a059-3004-4f61-a83d-200390885673.prompt=Host\: ff0af67a-7099-477d-aa54-481ebeef9164.6c4e2707-02d8-47bd-8e1a-f4077b480a60.description=
Restarts a Windows service. This service must be set to start in Automatic or Manual mode. Services set to Disabled cannot be restarted using this operation. All the services that the given service depends on will also be restarted. 
The given host must have the Server service (LanManServer) running in order for the flow to work. For this reason, if you try to restart this service the flow will stop it, but won`t be able to start it again. 

Inputs\:
host 	- The host on which the service resides.
service 	- The service to restart.
altuser 	- The username to use when authenticating with host (Example\: domain\username).
altpass 	- The password to use when authenticating with host.

Responses\:
success 		- Service restarted successfully.
failure 		- Service could not be restarted.
service failed to restart 	- Service was stopped, but would not restart.
service didn't stop 	- Service failed to stop.

Extra Results\:
serviceRestartResult - The return code of the service restart operation.
ff0af67a-7099-477d-aa54-481ebeef9164.8058c182-20cf-4452-bfce-05272287a0a4.description=This operation allows a user to select its response, thereby specifying what path of execution a flow takes. When the step is started the user will be prompted to select which of its responses to follow. ff0af67a-7099-477d-aa54-481ebeef9164.8058c182-20cf-4452-bfce-05272287a0a4.prompt=The service '${service}' is stopped, and does not automatically start. How would you like to resolve this? ff0af67a-7099-477d-aa54-481ebeef9164.8629bfde-6bb9-4aa1-916f-50a1898c36e2.description=
Useful Op to keep a running results.
Takes a string input (resultText) and appends this to a global context key of "runningResults". As a result, the context key whose name is in the keyName input will be appended with the string from the input resultText.

Input Parameters\:
keyName - name of context key to append to
resultText - string input to append
delimiter - (leave blank for none) the delimiter to put between what is already in keyName before appending resultText

Responses\:
success - assigned the context variable

Returns\:
The the value of the context variable it appended to.

Context\:
runningResults

Scriptlet Example\:
currentResults \= scriptletContext.get("runningResults");

if (currentResults \=\= null) {
   currentResults \= resultText;
} else {
   currentResults +\= resultText;
}


scriptletContext.putGlobal("runningResults", currentResults);
ff0af67a-7099-477d-aa54-481ebeef9164.88b09ae3-f1ec-4f4e-9cad-9b82eb31d0d5.description=
Pings the target computer from a Windows host computer.

Input Parameters\:
host 		- The hostname or IP address of the host computer to ping from.
user 		- Username to use for remote WMI impersonation and thread impersonation on the RAS host for this operation (can be left blank). The user to authenticate as.
password 		- Password of the user.
target 		- The target computer to ping.
packets 		- The number of packets to send to the target computer.
packetSize 		- The size of packets to send to the target computer.
command 		- DO NOT CHANGE THIS VALUE.
characterSet 	- The character encoding of the target computer. The default is UTF-8.
outputPath 		- A network accessible path used by the operation to store temporary files. If not specified it points to \\host\admin$\temp\'. If this path is not accessible it should be changed to use another share that the local system account on the host computer has write-access to. By default, the path must be changed on Windows 2000 computers.

Responses\:
success 		- The target computer responded to all ping requests.
failure 		- The target computer did not respond to any ping request.
diagnosed		- The target computer responded only to some ping requests.
Connection Error	- The host computer could not be found or user credentials supplied to connect to it are incorrect.
Unknown Target	- The target computer could not be resolved to an IP address.

Result\:
The output of the ping operation.

Extra Results\:
returnResult		- The raw output of the Ping operation.
address 		- The actual IP address of the target computer.
% Packet Loss 	- The percentage of packets that ping replies were not received for.
average latency	- The average ping response time in milliseconds.
max latency 		- The maximum response time of all the ping reqeusts (in milliseconds).
min latency 		- The minimum number of milliseconds that was taken to receive a ping response.
ff0af67a-7099-477d-aa54-481ebeef9164.890f86e5-8c46-49c4-af67-02a174912cb3.prompt=List of services\: ff0af67a-7099-477d-aa54-481ebeef9164.8bd1b5f3-38b3-4d18-a530-9c0e188372bd.description=
Starts a service if it's start mode is set to Automatic.

Inputs\:
host - the host to start the service on.
service - the service to start.
altuser - username for host.
altpass - password for altuser.

Results\:
error - the exception message in case of failure. If the flow succeeds, this should be an empty string.

Responses\:
start type is not automatic - service not started, because its start type is not automatic.
failure - could not determine service start type, or could not start service.
success - service started.
ff0af67a-7099-477d-aa54-481ebeef9164.8d52ed83-6b64-4bc7-a470-b898e3f2deb9.prompt=Target host\: ff0af67a-7099-477d-aa54-481ebeef9164.8dda7ae8-b332-4c15-a742-5dd1b066ea63.transition.description=Could not start ${service} ff0af67a-7099-477d-aa54-481ebeef9164.a57c6a85-a69c-4706-80f8-3f196b119028.prompt=Windows Username\: ff0af67a-7099-477d-aa54-481ebeef9164.afd41774-0634-4287-9e97-4629092c08a4.prompt=HostName\: ff0af67a-7099-477d-aa54-481ebeef9164.b4e0baa8-53af-4b67-8006-006c14d3959d.prompt=Service Name\: ff0af67a-7099-477d-aa54-481ebeef9164.be7df168-453a-4d5e-91dd-1d63ba987e21.transition.description=${service} does not exist ff0af67a-7099-477d-aa54-481ebeef9164.c3458873-bcb9-4264-bfda-a201f08bfd84.transition.description=Started ${service} successfully ff0af67a-7099-477d-aa54-481ebeef9164.c7bb16d4-afa3-4ae2-bf12-7b001817f947.prompt=Delimiter used in the list of services\: ff0af67a-7099-477d-aa54-481ebeef9164.description=
Checks the status of list of Windows services on a computer. Services that are already running are ignored. If the startup mode of the service is automatic and the service not running, it is started. However, if the startup mode is not automatic and the service is not running, then the operation prompts the user to start the service or leave it as it is.

Inputs\:
host	- The host name or IP address of the target Windows computer to check services status on.
username	- Username to use for remote WMI impersonation and thread impersonation on the RAS host for this operation (can be left blank). The user to authenticate as.
password	- Password of the user.
services	- A delimited list of Windows services.
delimiter	- The delimiter used in the list of Windows services. It defaults to commma (,).
characterSet	- The character encoding of the target Windows computer. It defaults to UTF-8.

Extra Results\:
servicesRunning	- A delimited list of services that are running.
servicesNotRunning	- A delimited list of services that could not be started.
servicesInvalid	- A delimited list of services that are invalid.

Responses\:
success	- All services are running.
failure	- The operation failed while connecting to the target, or while iterating through the list of services.
diagnosed	- One or more services are invalid, or could not be started.
ff0af67a-7099-477d-aa54-481ebeef9164.e27530d3-70a5-4851-96b7-253a4be828b9.description=
Get the current status of a Windows service

Inputs\:
host - hostname or ip address of the target machine
service - name of service to change
user - alternate credentials username
password - alternate credentials password

Responses\:
service paused - the service is currently paused
service running - the service is currently running
service stopped - the service is currently stopped
service pending - the service is currently pending
failure - there was a problem getting the state of the service
ff0af67a-7099-477d-aa54-481ebeef9164.ea6c618e-67ba-4967-871a-a61046b896c0.description=
Useful Op to keep a running results.
Takes a string input (resultText) and appends this to a global context key of "runningResults". As a result, the context key whose name is in the keyName input will be appended with the string from the input resultText.

Context\:

Scriptlet Example\:

if (currentResults \=\= null) {

} else {

scriptletContext.putGlobal("runningResults", currentResults);

Useful Op to keep a running results.

flow.name: Check Services List

modelValue.stringValue: What would you like to do?
